conclusion: Analyze how the liquid flows through the setup by examining three sequential images.
Image 1 shows five colored tabs on top labeled A, B, and C, multiple colored baffles arranged diagonally, and two containers at the bottom labeled D and E.
Image 2 shows yellow liquid flowing from A, blue liquid from B, and green liquid from C, all interacting with the baffles.
Image 3 shows yellow liquid from A moving left after hitting the gray baffle, blue liquid from B deflecting toward the black baffle, and green liquid from C merging with the blue stream.
Yellow liquid (A) hits the gray baffle and changes direction toward the left.
Blue liquid (B) hits the cyan baffle and flows downward toward the black baffle.
Green liquid (C) flows downward and joins with the blue stream.
Black baffle redirects most liquid toward the left side.
Majority of liquid (blue, green, and yellow) appears to be collecting on the left side.
Most of the liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into container D.
